structured_data.overview: This document is the 1992 General Plan for the City of El Segundo, California. It outlines the city's development goals, policies, and planning elements as required by California state law. The plan covers the entire geographic area within city limits and addresses physical, economic, and social development issues.

contacts.name: Hyrum B. Fedje
contacts.title: Director of Planning and Building Safety

documents.title: The City of El Segundo General Plan 1992
documents.description: Comprehensive plan for city development adopted December 1, 1992 via Ordinance Number 1189

structured_data.other_info: The City of El Segundo is 5.46 square miles (3,494.4 acres), with a resident population of 15,223 people (1990 Census) and a daytime employee population of approximately 80,000. It is located in the Los Angeles urban area, part of the Airport/South Bay subregion. The city borders Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) to the north, Del Aire and Hawthorne to the east, Manhattan Beach to the south, and the Pacific Ocean to the west. City facilities include Recreation Park, Library Park, Hilltop Park, Acacia Park, Washington Park, Candy Cane Park, Sycamore Parkette, Kansas Parkette, Constitution Park, Library, Middle School, El Segundo High School, Continuation School, Elementary School, and Civic Center Downtown Area.
